[@sarbian](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57146-sarbian/) can you update the link in the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> ?
Does anyone know where to find the 1.3.1 version?

It seems that the Modular Flight Integrator has caused the Comnet dish at the Inland Space Center to disappear.  I went through my mods and this was the one that changed things.  This was in the Mission Builder.

Photo without MFI installed:

![zWDPqye.png](https://i.imgur.com/zWDPqye.png)

Photo with MFI installed:

![H6Mzcey.png](https://i.imgur.com/H6Mzcey.png)

Should I grab the last version even for ksp 1.3.1?  

I am experiencing a lot of lag on <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAb</abbr>/<abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr> and it seems to be <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> related, so if anyone can help me....

Hi,

I have a KSP Install with many mods and get the following error when I reenter the atmosphere (of Kerbin):

    [ERR 10:25:04.090] TimingFI threw during Update: System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Argument is out of range.
    Parameter name: index
      at System.Collections.Generic.List`1[OcclusionData].get_Item (Int32 index) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at FlightIntegrator.UpdateOcclusionConvection () [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at FlightIntegrator.UpdateOcclusion (Boolean all) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at ModularFI.ModularFlightIntegrator.UpdateOcclusion (Boolean all) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at FlightIntegrator.Update () [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at ModularFI.ModularFlightIntegrator.TimedUpdate () [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at (wrapper delegate-invoke) Callback:invoke_void__this__ ()
      at (wrapper delegate-invoke) Callback:invoke_void__this__ ()
      at TimingFI.Update () [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 

The complete log can be found here:

[https://drive.google.com/open?id=15D4SvmYpFGMqv6te87wgaiPRrCvqUn1_](https://drive.google.com/open?id=15D4SvmYpFGMqv6te87wgaiPRrCvqUn1_)

(it was to big for pastebin)

When entering the atmosphere, the craft begins to wobble (every polygon not only the connections between parts) and doesnt respond to drag or gravity anymore.

I hope someone here can point me in the right direction to find the origin of this error. Maybe an incompatible mod?

I posted this here because ModularFlightIntegrator was the only clue i could find in the log that was directly related to the problem.
I am traveling until the end of the month so I can't look into it for now. Maybe someone else can...

@[@X52](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/123254-x52/) Happening to me as well, but during ascent and reentry. always around the 10 km mark.

the log just repeats this over and over:

    [LOG 19:21:06.682] Look rotation viewing vector is zero
    [ERR 19:21:06.682] TimingFI threw during FixedUpdate: System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Argument is out of range.
    Parameter name: index
      at System.Collections.Generic.List`1[OcclusionData].get_Item (Int32 index) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at FlightIntegrator.UpdateOcclusionSolar () [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at FlightIntegrator.UpdateOcclusion (Boolean all) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at ModularFI.ModularFlightIntegrator.UpdateOcclusion (Boolean all) [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at FlightIntegrator.FixedUpdate () [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at ModularFI.ModularFlightIntegrator.TimedFixedUpdate () [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 
      at TimingFI.FixedUpdate () [0x00000] in  unknown>:0 

quicksaving and loading fixes it sometimes, but then it happens again

**Edited <time datetime="2019-04-18T02:40:08Z" title="04/18/2019 02:40  AM" data-short="5 yr">April 18, 2019</time> by Bill the Kerbal**
  
log
Could you release version compatible with 1.7 soon? Because Kopernicus requires your mod, and I therefore can't use any planet packs (my favorite kind of mod) until it's updated.
Is ModuleFlightIntegrator still being maintained?

> 
> 
> On 6/1/2019 at 10:50 PM, Scotskerb said:
> 
> 
> Could you release version compatible with 1.7 soon? Because Kopernicus requires your mod, and I therefore can't use any planet packs (my favorite kind of mod) until it's updated.
> 

Yes you can. Just tell <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> to not hide mods marked for previous KSP versions. 

MFI appears to work just fine on 1.7.3. 

Ps. It’s considered rude to demand updates. Especially when a few minutes of checking could’ve told you that it works just fine. 

**Edited <time datetime="2019-08-25T01:02:23Z" title="08/25/2019 01:02  AM" data-short="4 yr">August 25, 2019</time> by Jognt**

Hey guys,

> 
> 
> On 6/1/2019 at 10:50 PM, Scotskerb said:
> 
> 
> Could you release version compatible with 1.7 soon? Because Kopernicus requires your mod, and I therefore can't use any planet packs (my favorite kind of mod) until it's updated.

It is fairly easy to rebuild the mod as-is yourself. Also:

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, Jognt said:
> 
> 
> Yes you can. Just tell <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> to not hide mods marked for previous KSP versions. 
>

> 
> MFI appears to work just fine on 1.7.3. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Ps. It’s considered rude to demand updates. Especially when a few minutes of checking could’ve told you that it works just fine.
> 

If you "require" the library to be built against 1.7.3, you can grab my personal copy [here](https://dev.azure.com/rory-slegtenhorst/_apis/resources/Containers/3269640?itemPath=ModularFlightIntegrator&%24format=zip). I recreated several builds on Azure DevOps which you can find [here](https://dev.azure.com/rory-slegtenhorst/ksp/), and run them especially when a new KSP release is rolled out.

N.B. this is just a plain compile from the master branch, just like sarbian's Jenkins pipeline (I literally copied the command that performs the compilation).  

The only thing I actually update is bumping the version during the build from 1.2.6.0 -> 1.2.6.1 to distinguish the dll's

> Is ModuleFlightIntegrator still being maintained?

Fair enough. Build has been removed and project set to private, so the links won't work anymore.

1.2.7 - KSP 1.8 Build

Download : [ModularFlightIntegrator-1.2.7.0.zip](https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/ModularFlightIntegrator/33/artifact/ModularFlightIntegrator-1.2.7.0.zip)
The mod breaks the main menu, now none of the buttons respond to my inputs.
Please update the plugin. Ferram Aerospace Research depends on it.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Krzeszny said:
> 
> 
> Please update the plugin. Ferram Aerospace Research depends on it.
> 

Is it not working for you?  

If not, please describe the issue, and provide logs and list of installed mods.  

You can find out how to post logs here:  

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedauthorid="75006" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed2298854067" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/83212-how-to-get-support-read-first/&do=embed" style="height:209px;max-width:500px;"></iframe>

>

> Is it not working for you?  
>

> If not, please describe the issue, and provide logs and list of installed mods.  
>

>

> 

Who says it *should* be working? It's officially compatible with 1.8.9, not 1.9.1.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Krzeszny said:
> 
> 
> Who says it *should* be working? It's officially compatible with 1.8.9, not 1.9.1.
> 

<abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> for 1.9.x includes the 1.8 version of ModularFlightIntegrator in the download so you can assume that it still works without an update ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> 16 minutes ago, 4x4cheesecake said:
> 
> 
> <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> for 1.9.x includes the 1.8 version of ModularFlightIntegrator in the download so you can assume that it still works without an update ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

I would rather not *assume* something is working... Ok, ok, I actually do it all the time while building my rockets.

But if it really is compatible, [@sarbian](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57146-sarbian/) please update the metadata or something so that <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> sees it as compatible. <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> doesn't show up in the mods list even though it's a great mod, and having to select 1.8 in <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>'s settings is both inconvenient and gives users lots of doubts, unless they dig around the forums, which kind of defeats the purpose of <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>. Plus, there are no official news whether or not Modular Flight Integrator is 100% compatible with 1.9.1. Thank you.

ModularFlightIntegrator, by the power invested in me by the edit button I deem thee compatible with KSP 1.9.x.

So say we all.

Does MFI happen to have a debug mode?

I'm trying to find the cause of phantom forces ([these](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8_xiHkE7RIo)) and noticed MFI mentioned stuff like axisGroupsModule/VesselModuleRotation in the log. I'm hoping MFI could help with figuring out where these forces come from.
